item.name: Auth

request.description:
### Register User

This endpoint is used to register a new user.

#### Request Body

- email (text, required): The email address of the user.
    
- password (text, required): The password for the user account.
    
- picture (file, optional): The profile picture of the user.
    
- first_name (text, optional): The first name of the user.
    
- second_name (text, optional): The second name of the user.
    
- last_name (text, optional): The last name of the user.
    

#### Response

The response for this request is in the JSON format and has the following structure:

``` json
{
  "status": "string",
  "data": {
    "id": "number",
    "first_name": "string",
    "second_name": "string",
    "last_name": "string",
    "full_name": "string",
    "picture_url": "string",
    "email": "string",
    "email_verified_at": "string",
    "joined_at": "string",
    "profile": "string"
  },
  "message": "string"
}

 ```

request.description:
### Update Profile

This endpoint allows the user to update their profile information.

#### Request Body

- `first_name` (string, required): The first name of the user.
    
- `second_name` (string, required): The second name of the user.
    
- `last_name` (string, required): The last name of the user.
    

#### Response

- `status` (string): The status of the response.
    
- `data` (object): An object containing the user's updated profile information.
    
    - `id` (integer): The unique identifier of the user.
        
    - `first_name` (string): The updated first name of the user.
        
    - `second_name` (string): The updated second name of the user.
        
    - `last_name` (string): The updated last name of the user.
        
    - `full_name` (string): The full name of the user.
        
    - `picture_url` (string): The URL of the user's profile picture.
        
    - `email` (string): The email address of the user.
        
    - `email_verified_at` (datetime): The date and time when the email was verified.
        
    - `joined_at` (datetime): The date and time when the user joined.
        
    - `profile` (object): Additional profile information.
        
- `message` (string): Any additional message related to the response.
    

#### Example

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "id": 0,
        "first_name": "",
        "second_name": "",
        "last_name": "",
        "full_name": "",
        "picture_url": "",
        "email": "",
        "email_verified_at": null,
        "joined_at": "",
        "profile": null
    },
    "message": ""
}

 ```

item.description:
# Authentication & Profile API Routes

## Guest Routes
These routes are accessible only to unauthenticated users (`guest` middleware).

| Method | Endpoint              | Controller Method     | Description                     |
|--------|-----------------------|-----------------------|---------------------------------|
| POST   | `/register`           | `register`           | Register a new user.           |
| POST   | `/login`              | `login`              | Authenticate and log in a user. |
| POST   | `/forgot-password`    | `forgotPassword`     | Send a password reset link.    |
| POST   | `/reset-password`     | `resetPassword`      | Reset user password.           |

---

## Authenticated Routes
These routes require authentication using Sanctum (`auth:sanctum` middleware).

### Authentication Actions
| Method  | Endpoint            | Controller Method   | Description                    |
|---------|---------------------|---------------------|--------------------------------|
| POST    | `/logout`           | `logout`           | Log out the authenticated user. |
| DELETE  | `/delete-account`   | `deleteAccount`    | Delete the user's account.     |

### Profile Management (`/profile`)
| Method  | Endpoint                  | Controller Method   | Description                      |
|---------|---------------------------|---------------------|----------------------------------|
| GET     | `/profile/`               | `index`            | Get user profile details.       |
| PUT     | `/profile/`               | `update`           | Update user profile information. |
| POST    | `/profile/change-password` | `changePassword`   | Change user password.           |

## Middleware
- **`guest`**: Ensures that only unauthenticated users can access the guest routes.
- **`auth:sanctum`**: Restricts access to authenticated users for secure actions.

request.description:
## Profile Health Information

This endpoint retrieves the health profile information for the user.

### Request

`GET /profile/health`

### Response

- Content-Type: application/json

request.description:
### Profile Health Endpoint

This endpoint allows the user to submit their health profile information.

#### Request Body

- `birth_date` (string): The user's date of birth.
    
- `weight` (number): The user's weight in kilograms.
    
- `height` (number): The user's height in centimeters.
    
- `gender` (string): The user's gender.
    
- `health_goal` (string): The user's health goal (e.g., gain, lose, maintain).
    
- `activity_level` (string): The user's activity level.
    
- `receive_daily_report` (boolean): Indicates if the user wants to receive a daily health report.
    
- `dietary_preference` (string): The user's dietary preference.
    
- `medical_conditions` (array): An array of IDs representing the user's medical conditions.
    
- `family_medical_history` (array): An array of IDs representing the user's family medical history.
    
- `allergies` (array): An array of IDs representing the user's allergies.
    

#### Response (201 - Created)

The response body will be in JSON format with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "status": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "message": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  }
}

 ```

The response will contain the status and a message indicating the success of the request.

### Request Body

- `birth_date`: The user's birth date.
    
- `weight`: The user's weight.
    
- `height`: The user's height.
    
- `gender`: The user's gender.
    
- `health_goal`: The user's health goal.
    
- `activity_level`: The user's activity level.
    
- `receive_daily_report`: Boolean indicating whether the user wants to receive daily reports.
    
- `dietary_preference`: The user's dietary preference.
    
- `medical_conditions`: An array of IDs representing the user's medical conditions.
    
- `family_medical_history`: An array of IDs representing the user's family medical history.
    
- `allergies`: An array of IDs representing the user's allergies.

item.description:
# ðŸ“‚ Health Profile Routes (Requires Authentication)

These API endpoints allow authenticated users to manage their health profile, including personal details, medical conditions, allergies, and dietary preferences.

## ðŸ“Œ API Endpoints

| **Method** | **Endpoint**       | **Description** |
|------------|-------------------|-----------------|
| `GET`      | `/profile/health`  | Retrieve the authenticated user's health profile. |
| `POST`     | `/profile/health`  | Create a new health profile for the authenticated user. |
| `PUT`      | `/profile/health`  | Update the authenticated user's health profile. |
| `DELETE`   | `/profile/health`  | Delete the authenticated user's health profile. |

## ðŸ“Œ Folder Description

This folder contains routes related to managing the **Health Profile**. The profile includes personal attributes such as **age, height, weight, gender, health goals, activity levels, dietary preferences**, and medical-related information like **allergies, medical conditions, and family medical history**.

- A **user profile must exist** before accessing most of these routes.  
- If no profile exists, users must first create one using the **POST** request.  
- The system automatically calculates **daily caloric targets** and **macronutrient distributions** based on user data.  
- Updates to medical conditions or allergies **affect dietary recommendations**.  
- Deleting a profile will also remove associated **medical conditions, allergies, and progress data**.

**âš ï¸ Note:**  
- These endpoints **require authentication** via Sanctum (`auth:sanctum`).  
- A `404 Not Found` error is returned if a user tries to access health data without an existing profile.

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of public medical conditions.

### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

### Response

- `status` (string): Indicates the status of the response.
    
- `data` (array): Contains an array of medical conditions, where each item has the following properties:
    
    - `id` (number): The unique identifier for the medical condition.
        
    - `name` (string): The name of the medical condition.
        
- `message` (string): Additional information or message related to the response.
    

Example response:

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 0,
            "name": ""
        }
    ],
    "message": ""
}

 ```

item.description:
# ðŸ“‚ Public Routes (No Authentication Required)

These endpoints provide general information required for health-related queries. They are accessible without authentication.

## ðŸ“Œ API Endpoints

| **Method** | **Endpoint**                     | **Description** |
|------------|----------------------------------|-----------------|
| `GET`      | `/public/allergies`             | Get a list of common allergies. |
| `GET`      | `/public/medical-conditions`    | Get a list of recognized medical conditions. |
| `GET`      | `/public/activity-levels`       | Get available activity levels for fitness tracking. |
| `GET`      | `/public/cuisines`              | Get different cuisines available for meal planning. |
| `GET`      | `/public/dishes`                | Get common dish types to help with meal recommendations. |
| `GET`      | `/public/dietary-preferences`   | Get dietary preferences (e.g., vegan, keto, etc.). |

## ðŸ“Œ Folder Description

This folder contains public API endpoints that provide reference data such as allergies, medical conditions, activity levels, cuisines, dishes, and dietary preferences. These endpoints are useful for users selecting health-related preferences.

item.name: Recipes

request.description:
### Get Favorite Recipes

This endpoint retrieves a list of favorite recipes for the user.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{base_url}}/profile/recipes/favorites`
    

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following structure:

- `status` (string): Indicates the status of the response.
    
- `data` (array): An array of favorite recipe objects, each containing the following fields:
    
    - `id` (number): The unique identifier of the recipe.
        
    - `title` (string): The title of the recipe.
        
    - `summary` (string): A brief summary of the recipe.
        
    - `image` (string): URL of the recipe image.
        
    - `servings` (number): Number of servings the recipe yields.
        
    - `ready_in_minutes` (number): Time required to prepare the recipe in minutes.
        
    - `source_url` (string): URL of the recipe source.
        
    - `cheap` (number): Indicates if the recipe is budget-friendly.
        
    - `vegetarian` (number): Indicates if the recipe is vegetarian.
        
    - `vegan` (number): Indicates if the recipe is vegan.
        
    - `very_healthy` (number): Indicates if the recipe is very healthy.
        
    - `health_score` (number): Health score of the recipe.
        
    - `cuisines` (array): Array of cuisines associated with the recipe.
        
    - `dish_types` (array): Array of dish types for the recipe.
        
    - `diets` (array): Array of dietary categories for the recipe.
        
    - `ingredients` (array): Array of ingredients required for the recipe.
        
    - `instructions` (string): Detailed instructions for preparing the recipe.
        
    - `calories` (number): Total calories in the recipe.
        
    - `protein` (number): Protein content in the recipe.
        
    - `carbs` (number): Carbohydrate content in the recipe.
        
    - `fat` (number): Fat content in the recipe.
        
    - `is_favorite` (number): Indicates if the recipe is marked as a favorite by the user.
        
    - `user_id` (number): The user identifier associated with the recipe.
        
    - `created_at` (string): Timestamp of when the recipe was added to favorites.

### Remove Favorite Recipe

This endpoint is used to remove a recipe from the user's list of favorite recipes.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body. The recipe_id is passed as a query parameter in the URL.

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format with the following schema:

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "id": 0,
        "title": "",
        "summary": "",
        "image": "",
        "servings": 0,
        "ready_in_minutes": 0,

        "fat": 0,
        "is_favorite": true,

}
 ```

request.description:
### GET /profile/recipes/2

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific recipe based on the provided ID.

#### Request

There are no request parameters for this endpoint.

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format and will contain the following fields:

- `status` (string): The status of the response.
    
- `data` (object): An object containing the details of the recipe.
    
    - `id` (number): The unique identifier of the recipe.
        
    - `title` (string): The title of the recipe.
        
    - `summary` (string): A brief summary of the recipe.
        
    - `image` (string): The URL of the image associated with the recipe.
        
    - `servings` (number): The number of servings the recipe yields.
        
    - `ready_in_minutes` (number): The time required to prepare the recipe in minutes.
        
    - `source_url` (string): The URL of the source from which the recipe is obtained.
        
    - `cheap` (number): Indicates if the recipe is budget-friendly (0 or 1).
        
    - `vegetarian` (number): Indicates if the recipe is vegetarian (0 or 1).
        
    - `vegan` (number): Indicates if the recipe is vegan (0 or 1).
        
    - `very_healthy` (number): Indicates if the recipe is very healthy (0 or 1).
        
    - `health_score` (number): The health score of the recipe.
        
    - `cuisines` (array): An array of cuisines associated with the recipe.
        
    - `dish_types` (array): An array of dish types associated with the recipe.
        
    - `diets` (array): An array of diets associated with the recipe.
        
    - `ingredients` (array): An array of ingredients required for the recipe.
        
    - `instructions` (string): The cooking instructions for the recipe.
        
    - `calories` (number): The calorie count of the recipe.
        
    - `protein` (number): The protein content of the recipe.
        
    - `carbs` (number): The carbohydrate content of the recipe.
        
    - `fat` (number): The fat content of the recipe.
        
    - `is_favorite` (number): Indicates if the recipe is marked as a favorite by the user (0 or 1).
        
    - `user_id` (number): The ID of the user who created the recipe.
        
    - `created_at` (string): The timestamp when the recipe was created.
        

#### Example

``` json
{
  "status": "",
  "data": {
    "id": 0,
    "title": "",
    "summary": "",
    "image": "",
    "servings": 0,
    "ready_in_minutes": 0,
    "source_url": "",
    "cheap": 0,
    "vegetarian": 0,
    "vegan": 0,
    "very_healthy": 0,
    "health_score": 0,
    "cuisines": [],
    "dish_types": [""],
    "diets": [""],
    "ingredients": [""],
    "instructions": "",
    "calories": 0,
    "protein": 0,
    "carbs": 0,
    "fat": 0,
    "is_favorite": 0,
    "user_id": 0,
    "created_at": ""
  }
}

 ```

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to create a new recipe in the user's profile. The request should be sent as an HTTP POST to {{base_url}}/profile/recipes with a form-data request body. The request body should include parameters such as title, image, summary, servings, ready_in_minutes, source_url, and various nutritional information like calories, protein, carbs, and fat. Additionally, you can specify attributes like cheap, vegetarian, vegan, and very_healthy, and provide a list of cuisines, dish types, and ingredients. The instructions for preparing the recipe can also be included.

### Request Body

- title (text): The title of the recipe.
    
- image (file): An image file representing the recipe.
    
- summary (text): A brief summary of the recipe.
    
- servings (text): The number of servings the recipe yields.
    
- ready_in_minutes (text): The time required to prepare the recipe.
    
- source_url (text): The source URL of the recipe.
    
- cheap (text): Indicates if the recipe is budget-friendly.
    
- vegetarian (text): Indicates if the recipe is vegetarian.
    
- vegan (text): Indicates if the recipe is vegan.
    
- very_healthy (text): Indicates if the recipe is very healthy.
    
- health_score (text): The health score of the recipe.
    
- cuisines\[\] (text): An array of cuisines associated with the recipe.
    
- dish_types\[\] (text): An array of dish types associated with the recipe.
    
- ingredients\[\] (text): An array of ingredients required for the recipe.
    
- instructions (text): The cooking instructions for the recipe.
    
- calories (text): The calorie count of the recipe.
    
- protein (text): The protein content of the recipe.
    
- carbs (text): The carbohydrate content of the recipe.
    
- fat (text): The fat content of the recipe.
    
- is_favorite (text): Indicates if the recipe is marked as a favorite.
    

### Response

Upon successful creation, the response will have a status code of 200 and a JSON body containing the newly created recipe's details, including its unique ID, title, image, summary, servings, ready_in_minutes, source_url, nutritional information, attributes, and creation timestamp.

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "id": 0,
        "title": "",
        "summary": "",
        "image": "",
        "servings": "",
        "ready_in_minutes": "",
        "source_url": "",
        "cheap": "",
        "vegetarian": "",
        "vegan": "",
        "very_healthy": "",
        "health_score": "",
        "cuisines": [""],
        "dish_types": [""],
        "diets": null,
        "ingredients": [""],
        "instructions": "",
        "calories": "",
        "protein": "",
        "carbs": "",
        "fat": "",
        "is_favorite": "",
        "user_id": 0,
        "created_at": ""
    },
    "message": ""
}

 ```

request.description:
### Update Recipe

This endpoint is used to update a specific recipe in the user's profile.

#### Request Body

- title (string): The title of the recipe.
    
- summary (string): A brief summary of the recipe.
    
- servings (number): The number of servings the recipe yields.
    
- ready_in_minutes (number): The time required to prepare the recipe.
    
- source_url (string): The URL of the recipe source.
    
- cheap (boolean): Indicates if the recipe is budget-friendly.
    
- vegetarian (boolean): Indicates if the recipe is vegetarian.
    
- vegan (boolean): Indicates if the recipe is vegan.
    
- very_healthy (boolean): Indicates if the recipe is very healthy.
    
- health_score (number): The health score of the recipe.
    
- cuisines (array of strings): The cuisines associated with the recipe.
    
- dish_types (array of strings): The dish types of the recipe.
    
- diets (array of strings): The diets the recipe complies with.
    
- ingredients (array of strings): The list of ingredients required for the recipe.
    
- instructions (string): The cooking instructions for the recipe.
    
- calories (number): The calorie content of the recipe.
    
- protein (number): The protein content of the recipe.
    
- carbs (number): The carbohydrate content of the recipe.
    
- fat (number): The fat content of the recipe.
    
- is_favorite (boolean): Indicates if the recipe is marked as a favorite.
    

#### Response Body

- status (string): The status of the response.
    
- data (object): The updated recipe data.
    
    - id (number): The unique identifier of the recipe.
        
    - title (string): The title of the recipe.
        
    - summary (string): A brief summary of the recipe.
        
    - image (string): The image URL of the recipe.
        
    - servings (number): The number of servings the recipe yields.
        
    - ready_in_minutes (number): The time required to prepare the recipe.
        
    - source_url (string): The URL of the recipe source.
        
    - cheap (boolean): Indicates if the recipe is budget-friendly.
        
    - vegetarian (boolean): Indicates if the recipe is vegetarian.
        
    - vegan (boolean): Indicates if the recipe is vegan.
        
    - very_healthy (boolean): Indicates if the recipe is very healthy.
        
    - health_score (number): The health score of the recipe.
        
    - cuisines (array of strings): The cuisines associated with the recipe.
        
    - dish_types (array of strings): The dish types of the recipe.
        
    - diets (array of strings): The diets the recipe complies with.
        
    - ingredients (array of strings): The list of ingredients required for the recipe.
        
    - instructions (string): The cooking instructions for the recipe.
        
    - calories (number): The calorie content of the recipe.
        
    - protein (number): The protein content of the recipe.
        
    - carbs (number): The carbohydrate content of the recipe.
        
    - fat (number): The fat content of the recipe.
        
    - is_favorite (boolean): Indicates if the recipe is marked as a favorite.
        
    - user_id (number): The user ID associated with the recipe.
        
    - created_at (string): The timestamp of when the recipe was created.
        
- message (string): Any additional message related to the response.

request.description:
### Get Recommended Recipes

This endpoint retrieves a list of recommended recipes based on the specified criteria.

#### Request Parameters

- `number` (query parameter) - The number of recipes to retrieve.
    
- `offset` (query parameter) - The offset for paginating through the results.
    
- `type` (query parameter) - The type of recipe to filter by.
    
- `search` (query parameter) - Optional search keyword for filtering recipes.
    
- `for_me` (query parameter) - Flag to indicate if the recipes are personalized for the user.
    

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format with the following structure:

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "totalResults": 0,
        "offset": 0,
        "count": 0,
        "recipes": [
            {
                "id": 0,
                "title": "",
                "image": "",
                "calories": "",
                "carbs": "",
                "protein": "",
                "fat": ""
            }
        ]
    }
}

 ```

- `status` (string) - The status of the response.
    
- `totalResults` (number) - The total number of results available.
    
- `offset` (number) - The offset of the current results.
    
- `count` (number) - The count of recipes in the current response.
    
- `recipes` (array) - An array of recipe objects with their respective details such as id, title, image, calories, carbs, protein, and fat.

### Response

request.description:
### Get Recipes by Ingredients

This endpoint retrieves a list of recipes based on the provided ingredients.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: {{base_url}}/recipes/findByIngredients
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - ingredients (string, required): Comma-separated list of ingredients
        

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    
- { "status": "", "data": \[ { "id": 0, "title": "", "image": "", "imageType": "", "usedIngredientCount": 0, "missedIngredientCount": 0, "missedIngredients": \[ { "id": 0, "amount": 0, "unit": "", "unitLong": "", "unitShort": "", "aisle": "", "name": "", "original": "", "originalName": "", "meta": \[\], "image": "" } \], "usedIngredients": \[ { "id": 0, "amount": 0, "unit": "", "unitLong": "", "unitShort": "", "aisle": "", "name": "", "original": "", "originalName": "", "meta": \[""\], "extendedName": "", "image": "" } \], "unusedIngredients": \[ { "id": 0, "amount": 0, "unit": "", "unitLong": "", "unitShort": "", "aisle": "", "name": "", "original": "", "originalName": "", "meta": \[\], "image": "" } \], "likes": 0 } \]}

item.description:
# ðŸ“‚ Profile Routes (Authenticated)

This folder contains all API endpoints related to **user profile** actions, including managing recipes and favorites. These routes require authentication using **Sanctum**.

## ðŸ” Authentication

All requests in this folder require a **Bearer Token** from Laravel Sanctum. Ensure the user is logged in and has a valid token before making requests.

## ðŸ“Œ Endpoints

### 1ï¸âƒ£ Favorite Recipes

- **GET** `/profile/recipes/favorites` â†’ Retrieve a list of the userâ€™s favorite recipes.
    
- **POST** `/profile/recipes/favorites/add` â†’ Add a recipe to favorites.
    
- **POST** `/profile/recipes/favorites/remove` â†’ Remove a recipe from favorites.
    

### 2ï¸âƒ£ Recipes Management

- **GET** `/profile/recipes` â†’ Get a list of all recipes.
    
- **GET** `/profile/recipes/{id}` â†’ Get details of a specific recipe.
    
- **POST** `/profile/recipes` â†’ Create a new recipe.
    
- **PUT** `/profile/recipes/{id}` â†’ Update an existing recipe.
    
- **DELETE** `/profile/recipes/{id}` â†’ Delete a recipe.
    

## ðŸ“ Notes

- Ensure each request includes the `Authorization: Bearer {TOKEN}` header.
    
- Responses follow standard **JSON API format**.
    
- Use appropriate HTTP methods (`GET`, `POST`, `PUT`, `DELETE`) as per API specifications.

item.name: Progress

response.name: Success

request.description:
# Profile Progress

This endpoint retrieves the progress data for the user's profile.

## Request

### Method

GET

### URL

{{base_url}}/profile/progress

### Request Body

- date (text): The date for which the progress data is requested.
    

## Response

### Status Code

200

### Content Type

application/json

### Body

The response will contain the following structure:

- status (string): The status of the progress data.
    
- data (object): The progress data object containing the following fields:
    
    - date (string): The date for which the progress data is provided.
        
    - weight (number): The user's weight.
        
    - calories (object): The calorie consumption and burning data containing the following fields:
        
        - consumed (object): The consumed calorie data with value, target, and status.
            
        - burned (object): The burned calorie data with value, recommended, and status.
            
    - macronutrients (object): The macronutrient data containing protein, carbs, and fats.
        
    - notes (string): Additional notes related to the progress.
        

### Additional Details

- The request should include the date parameter in the form-data request body type.
    

This endpoint retrieves the progress data related to the user's profile.

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format with the following schema:

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "date": "",
        "weight": 0,
        "calories": {
            "consumed": {
                "value": 0,
                "target": 0,
                "status": ""
            },
            "burned": {
                "value": 0,
                "recommended": 0,
                "status": ""
            }
        },
        "macronutrients": {
            "protein": "",
            "carbs": "",
            "fats": ""
        },
        "notes": ""
    }
}

 ```

The `status` field indicates the status of the response, while the `data` object contains detailed progress information including date, weight, calories consumed and burned, macronutrient details, and any additional notes.

request.description:
### Profile Progress Analysis

This endpoint retrieves the analysis of the user's profile progress within a specified date range.

#### Request Body Parameters

- `start_date` (text) - The start date for the analysis.
    
- `end_date` (text) - The end date for the analysis.
    

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

``` json
{
    "start_date": "",
    "end_date": "",
    "initial_weight": 0,
    "current_weight": 0,
    "weight_change": 0,
    "total_calories_consumed": 0,
    "total_calories_burned": 0,
    "average_macronutrients": {
        "protein": 0,
        "carbs": 0,
        "fats": 0
    },
    "message": ""
}

 ```

The response provides the analysis of the user's profile progress, including initial and current weight, weight change, total calories consumed and burned, average macronutrient intake, and a message.

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "start_date": "",
    "end_date": "",
    "initial_weight": 0,
    "current_weight": 0,
    "weight_change": 0,
    "total_calories_consumed": 0,
    "total_calories_burned": 0,
    "average_macronutrients": {
        "protein": 0,
        "carbs": 0,
        "fats": 0
    },
    "message": ""
}

 ```

item.description:
# API Routes for User Profile Progress

## Authentication
All routes in this group require authentication using Sanctum middleware.

## Base Endpoint

### Progress Routes
These routes handle user progress management under the `/profile/progress` prefix.

| Method | Endpoint                 | Controller Method             | Description                                      |
|--------|--------------------------|-------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------|
| GET    | `/profile/progress/all`   | `ProgressController@index`    | Retrieve all progress records.                  |
| GET    | `/profile/progress`       | `ProgressController@getProgress` | Fetch the user's current progress data.         |
| PUT    | `/profile/progress`       | `ProgressController@updateProgress` | Update the user's progress.                     |
| GET    | `/profile/progress/analyze` | `ProgressController@analyzeProgress` | Analyze user progress for insights.             |

## Middleware
- **`auth:sanctum`**: Ensures that only authenticated users can access these routes.
